text: The word “amateur” is the descriptor. He had to print a Christian Doctrine that began with the phrase: “God made the world in seven days”; and he wanted to use on the sacred book the best cover he had: a beautiful crucifix, dressed in red and gold, with blue angels and wreaths of flowers, symbolic bands and columns, visible birds. Now the book began with “D”, and the oblique syllable was an “F”. The printer decided to lightly touch the original, and printed thus: “Frankly, God made the world in seven days.” (And it is a pity that he was not erudite in heterodox doctrines, for he could have put, with greater meaning, “Finally, God made the world in seven days.
title: El buen impresor
author: Alfonso Reyes
